Description: Lead strainer from the end of a tube for drinking wine.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21/478 Main City, House N.49.20
Curator's comments: Provisionally included in Gallery 61 list (Autumn 2007) Bibliography: G. Hart, 'Eyewitness Guides: Ancient Egypt' (1990), p.48; R. E Freed, Y. J. Markowitz and S. H. D'Auria (eds.), 'Pharaohs of the Sun: Akhenaten, Nefertiti, Tutankhamun' [exhibition catalogue] (Boston/New York/London, 1999), [115] = R. Freed, 'Farao's van de Zon' (Leiden, 2000), p. 239 [115]; T. Eric Peet & C. Leonard Woolley ‘et al.’, ‘The City of Akhenaten. Excavations of 1921 and 1922 at el-‘Amarneh’, Pt. I, (London 1923), p. 24, fig.5.
Published: B. J. Kemp, The City of Akhenaten and Nefertiti: Amarna and its People (Thames and Hudson 2012), p. 210.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 14 Nov-2000 6 Feb, USA, Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Pharaohs of the Sun : Akhenaten Nefertiti Tutakhamen
